iterations.note: Widened ATR-based stop loss multiplier to give long trades more room to survive noise before mean-reverting to VWAP. Timeout WR=64.1% confirms that trades surviving without being stopped are profitable — supports wider SL hypothesis. Priority axis: atrMult is #1 per optimization rules.

Wider VWAP sigma bands force entries at more extreme price deviations (2.5σ vs 2.0σ), increasing mean-reversion probability and growing the fixed reward (entry-to-VWAP distance) without changing the ATR-based SL.

Raise kill switch volume multiplier from 1.8x to 2.5x to reduce 4 forced exits (WR=0%, -$22.22). Volume 1.8x avg is routine noise in BTC 15m; 2.5x represents genuine spike. Allows trades to reach Timeout (WR=64%) or natural TP instead of being evicted prematurely.

change.to: close > emaD50 (Daily EMA 50 macro filter on longSignal)

iterations.note: Add Daily EMA 50 macro filter to longSignal: longs only allowed when close > emaD50 (bullish macro). Blocks longs in downtrend where VWAP mean-reversion has structurally lower WR. Pattern proven on BTC-SQZ where same filter improved PnL from +$50.70 to +$93.07. Implementation: request.security with [1] offset and lookahead_on (anti-repaint, same pattern as atr1h).

Shift Asia session start 1h later (18:00→19:00 ET) to remove transitional 22h UTC EDT-only slot (PF=0.64, 20 trades, -6.04 USD). In EDT this slot starts at 22h UTC (NY-close/Asia-open transition); in EST the old window already started at 23h UTC — explaining zero test-period trades at 22h UTC in walk-forward. Session-block adjustment generalizes better than individual hour filter.

Revert session shift from iter 5. Iter 5 moved window from 1800 to 1900 ET expecting to remove 20 bad Off-peak trades, but instead removed 13 net-profitable trades, dropping PnL from +15.67 to -2.13 and PF from 1.21 to 0.97. Prescribed revert per iter 5 explicit next-step condition: PF < 1.1 AND PnL fell.

Increase Short TP1 partial-close from 50% to 70% of position. Short TP2 has WR=42.9% (-$4.92 USD, 14 trades) — below breakeven. Locking 70% at TP1 (WR=62.5%) reduces the remaining position exposed to TP2 reversal risk from 50% to 30%. Prescribed by iter 6 next-step condition: PnL=+15.67 > 0 AND PF=1.21 between 1.1 and 1.3.

Raise KillSwitch volume threshold from 2.5x to 4.0x the 20-bar average. Reduces false positives from volSpike component in normal BTC 15m volatility. 2 KillSwitch exits with WR=0% and -$11.54 USD prescribed by iter 7 next-steps (PF 1.20-1.30 condition activated).

Raise extBands threshold from 2.5σ to 3.5σ (from 1.25x to 1.75x the VWAP band width). killSwitchVolMult 2.5→4.0 (iter 8) had ZERO impact — proves the 2 KillSwitch exits are triggered by consecOutside+beyondExtSigma, not volSpike. killSwitchSigma is the unexplored lever that controls beyondExtSigma directly.

Increase Short TP1 partial-close from 50% to 60% of position. KillSwitch exits are now 0 (killSwitchSigma=3.5 worked), so Short TP2 drag (WR=42.9%, -$4.92 USD, 14t) is no longer masked. Reduces position exposed to losing TP2 from 50% to 40%. Prescribed by iter 9 next-steps condition: KillSwitch exits = 0 AND PF < 1.30.

Tightens short entry from RSI > 65 to RSI > 70, and long entry from RSI < 35 to RSI < 30. Filters borderline overbought signals at 01h UTC (likely RSI 65-70 zone) which account for -$14.82 in losses (8 trades). Quality over quantity — structural diagnosis confirmed.

Extend trading session from 03:00 ET to 09:00 ET, adding 6 hours of London open (08:00-14:00 UTC). VWAP anchor (asiaStart at 18:00 ET) and session counter reset unchanged. First test of London VWAP-fade against Asia-anchored bands.

Increase session cap from 2 to 4 trades per 15-hour window. Cap resets at asiaStart (18:00 ET); Asia burns both slots before London, leaving 0 capacity for London/NY despite their excellent signal quality (PF 4.24–4.65). Increasing to 4 allows 2 additional London/NY trades per day.

Mandatory revert per iter 13 condition (Trades < 70 activated). Cap was proven neutral: raising 2→4 produced 0 additional trades (Asia averages 0.2 trades/session, cap never binding). Revert cleans up the ineffective change without altering metrics.

Lower entry band threshold from 2.0σ to 1.8σ to increase band-touch frequency in compressed London/NY windows. VWAP bands compress after extended Asia trading, making 2.0σ touches geometrically rarer post-Asia. Mandated by iter 14 next-steps.

change.from: inAsia and cooldownOk and sessionCapOk and noConsecLoss and dailyLossOk and not killSwitch
change.to: cooldownOk and sessionCapOk and noConsecLoss and dailyLossOk and not killSwitch and not isFriday

iterations.note: Remove inAsia gate (expands from 9h Asia window to 24/7); add isFriday block (removes Friday drag). VWAP anchor, session counter reset, and asiaEnd exit unchanged. Session cap (2) resets daily at asiaStart, providing London/NY capacity.
Relaxes RSI entry threshold: shorts now require RSI>60 (was >65), longs RSI<40 (was <35). Mandated by iter 16 next-steps conditional: Trades=36 < 50 after inAsia removal produced 0 new trades.
Close 100% of short position at TP1 (VWAP mid) instead of 50%, eliminating TP2 exposure. TP2 order remains in code but fires on 0 remaining quantity.

Relax RSI entry threshold: shorts now require RSI>55 (was >60), longs RSI<45 (was <40). The 2σ VWAP band touch provides primary confirmation; RSI 55-60 zone is densely populated within Asia window. Target: +15-20 trades to reach count≥80.

Revert rsiThreshold 45→40. Mandated by iter 19 next-steps: PF=0.74 < 1.2 (new RSI 55-60 entries are net losers) AND PnL=-27.90 < 0. Restores iter 19 pre-change baseline (61 trades, PF=1.24, PnL=+11.92).

Symmetric 5-point relaxation of RSI(2) entry thresholds. rsi2Long 15→20 (long oversold boundary), rsi2Short 85→80 (short overbought boundary). Mandated by iter 21 loop 5/5 'Next steps if fails' conditional: Trades=50 < 80 triggers this action. RSI(2) zone 15-20 / 80-85 occurs ~50% more frequently than strict ±15/85 extremes on BTC 15m.

change.from: longSignal requires close > ema200h; shortSignal requires close < ema200h
change.to: no EMA200 direction gate on either signal

iterations.note: Removed EMA200 1H direction filter from both longSignal and shortSignal. Mandated by iter 21 next-steps condition: PnL=-39.01 < -20 AND WR=37% < 40%. EMA200 was restricting longs to uptrend only (9 trades, WR=77.8%) while allowing shorts in downtrend only (45 trades, WR=28.9%), creating 83% short dominance with terrible WR. KC lower + RSI(2)<20 is a structurally valid extreme regardless of macro direction.

change.from: no volume gate on short entries
change.to: volume > 1.5 * ta.sma(volume, 20) required for short entry

iterations.note: Added volume filter to short entries only. Mandated by iter 22 condition 2: Trades=117 >= 80, PF=0.63 < 1.2, short WR=23.9% < 35%. Added global float volAvg20 = ta.sma(volume, 20) in indicators scope and shortVolOk = volume > 1.5 * volAvg20 gate on shortSignal. longSignal unchanged (long WR=52.1% is acceptable; short WR=23.9% is the primary loss driver at -98.16 USD / 46 trades).

Halved SL ATR multiplier in 'float stopDist = nz(atr1h) * 0.75'. Position size doubles (positionQty = riskTradeUsd / stopDist), so TP profit approximately doubles (~$8 → ~$16 per Long TP win) while SL loss remains fixed at $10 by design. Corrects adverse R:R from ~1:1.22 to ~1.6:1 favorable.

Widen SL stop distance from 0.75×ATR1H to 1.0×ATR1H (+33%). Reduces consecutive-loss blockade caused by 15m BTC noise triggering the tight 0.75x stop. Maintains position size 50% larger than original 1.5x baseline (R:R 1.23:1 favorable at avg win ≈$12.27 vs SL $10).

neverWorked.value: cooldownOk and sessionCapOk and noConsecLoss and dailyLossOk and not killSwitch and not isFriday
no EMA200 direction gate on either signal

emaD50: close > emaD50 (Daily EMA 50 macro filter on longSignal)
canTrade: cooldownOk and sessionCapOk and noConsecLoss and dailyLossOk and not killSwitch and not isFriday
ema200h_direction_filter: no EMA200 direction gate on either signal
shortVolOk: volume > 1.5 * ta.sma(volume, 20) required for short entry

pendingHypotheses.hypothesis: sigmaBand 2.0→2.5: wider bands produce more extreme entries with higher mean-reversion probability and larger TP targets relative to fixed SL
killSwitchVolMult 1.8→2.5: reduce forced KillSwitch exits (4 trades, WR=0%, -$22.22) by raising the volume spike threshold
Block Friday: simulation shows +$48.92 but walk-forward shows no robust confirmation (all hours unstable, pfRatio=0.24)
Block Fri: simulation +$48.92 but walk-forward without robust confirmation (pfRatio=0.24, all hours unstable)
Block hour 01h UTC: simulation +$24.27, walk-forward trainPnL=+9.25 (11t) vs testPnL=-33.52 (6t) — inverted in test
Short-only mode: block all longs (Long PnL=-$65.41 vs Short PnL=+$6.88) — removes 56 negative trades keeping 67 positive shorts
Short TP1 qty_percent 50%→70%: Short TP2 WR=42.9% losing -4.92 USD; locking more at TP1 reduces reversal exposure at TP2
Block Thu: simulation +12.79 USD, 22 trades removed, but walk-forward unconfirmed — overfit risk
killSwitchVolMult 2.5→4.0: 2 KillSwitch exits (WR=0%, -15.57 USD). 2.5x avg volume still too sensitive for BTC 15m. Estimated +10-15 USD.
Block Thu: simulation +$12.79 USD, 22 trades removed. Walk-forward unconfirmed — overfit risk.
Block Thu: simulation +$12.79 USD, 22 trades removed, walk-forward without robust confirmation
Short-only mode: block longs — longs already positive (+$6.70 USD) with EMA50 filter active, no justification
Short TP1 qty_percent 50→60%: reduces Short TP2 exposure (WR=42.9%, -$4.92); prescribed by iter 8 next-steps; but qty_percent=70 was already no_trade_impact in iter 7
Block Thu: simulation +$12.79 USD, 22 trades removed, walk-forward without robust confirmation — overfit risk
killSwitchSigma 3.5→4.5: KillSwitch exits already = 0, no justification to raise further; may remove legitimate protection
Block Thu: simulation +$14.02 USD, 22 trades removed, walk-forward unconfirmed — overfit risk
Block 01h UTC: simulation +$14.82, but only 8 train trades (< 10 stability rule), no walk-forward data
Block Thu: simulation +$7.27, walk-forward unconfirmed — overfit risk
Remove inAsia from canTrade entirely (24/7): broader but session cap resets only at asiaStart — London/NY trades after Asia could still be limited
maxTradesPerSession 2→6: more trades within Asia window — rejected because Asia PF=0.35, more Asia trades = more losses
cooldownBars 4→2: faster re-entry at 30min; primarily adds Asia trades (PF=0.87) — negative quality trade-off
Block Asia entirely: removes -$5.19 drag but reduces count from 54 to ~17 — catastrophically worsens count criterion
sigmaBand 2.0→1.8: lowers entry threshold generating more sigma-touch signals in compressed London bands; only unexplored direction (2.5 tested); est. +15-25 trades; risk PF approaches 1.4 floor
rsiThreshold 35→40: relaxes short entry to RSI>60, long to RSI<40; more moderate signals qualify; quality degradation risk
Block 01h UTC: removes 8 bad trades (+14.82 PnL est.) but directly worsens count criterion
Short TP1 qty_percent 50→100: eliminate TP2 (6t, WR=33.3%, -$4.78); converts TP2 losses to TP1 closes; quantifiable +$4-5 delta
STRUCTURAL escalation: VWAP fade Asia-specific (inAsia removal = 0 new trades), Asia PF=0.69, train WF worse than test — regime-specific pattern
Block 23h UTC: 24t, -$6.9 (walk-forward ✗ unstable); stability criterion not met
STRUCTURAL escalation: if PF fails to reach 1.4 after TP1=100% fix
Block 23h UTC: trainCount=8 < 10 minimum — stability rule not met; defer until new backtest confirms trainCount≥10
STRUCTURAL escalation: diminishing returns active, multiple parametric changes haven't broken PF past 1.4; recommend research if PF < 1.2 after this iter
timeoutBars 8→6: avg loser duration=7 bars clusters near timeout cap; shortening to 6 forces earlier exit on slow-moving losers (25t at WR=24% in current 105-trade state).
STRUCTURAL escalation: RSI threshold defines hard quality boundary; signal density cannot be increased via RSI relaxation. Recommend research phase for entry logic redesign.
timeoutBars 8→12: 76% of trades exit via timeout at WR=31.6%; avg loser duration=8 bars = exactly the cap; extending window gives slow KC mid reversions more time to complete
Remove EMA200 1H direction filter: shorts dominate 42/50 (84%) vs longs 8/50 (16%); regime filter may be creating selection bias; KC band + RSI(2) alone as quality gate
Reduce kcMultiplier 2.0->1.5: narrower KC bands bring TP target closer to entry, increasing probability of reaching KC mid within timeoutBars; also increases band touch frequency
Volume filter (volume > 1.5x 20-bar avg) on shorts only: screen low-participation overbought signals in shorts where reversion confidence is lower

Block NY session (13h-22h UTC): NY = -116.23 USD (79% total losses), WR=32.6% vs Asia WR=50%; KC+RSI(2) mean-reversion fails in trending NY session; session block removes 43 trades but recovers ~116 USD

STRUCTURAL escalation: Asia WR=50% = break-even even in best session; KC mid as TP is reachable ~50% of time; entry/exit logic may require redesign (kcMultiplier 2.0->1.5 for closer TP or ATR-based fixed TP)
Block hours 08h+16h (✓ robust walk-forward): −16 trades, +51.6 USD est. ΔPnL; blocked by stability rule (trainCount 3 and 7 < 10 minimum)
STRUCTURAL escalation: if atrMult fix insufficient, recommend research phase for multi-TP or ATR-based fixed TP system
Full revert stopDistAtrMult 0.75→1.5: guaranteed restoration of 113-trade regime but R:R 0.82:1 adverse; only fixes trade count criterion, not PnL/PF
STRUCTURAL escalation: KC mid TP + ATR1H SL design incompatible with 15m BTC noise; all atrMult values exhausted; recommend research (ATR-based TP or multi-TP partial close)
